name: electricity production, coal, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10549/documentation

This is a dataset used to create an aluminium industry specific electricity market for 'International Aluminium Institute (IAI) aluminium production Area 1' (Africa). The production volume represents the total amount of electricity from coal used in Area 1 (Africa) for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;The share of electricity produced using lignite and hard coal is calculated using both (1) estimates of the share of coal electricity coming from each country within Area 1; and  (2) ecoinvent v3.2 country-specific split of coal power plants between hard coal and lignite. The share of coal electricity in each country was calculated by distributing the total coal electricity used in aluminium production in Area 1 (Africa) region as reported by the International Aluminium Institute (IAI). The distribution is weighted by country-specific aluminium production volumes (source: IAI personal communication) and general grid mix in the respective countries (source: International Energy Agency). ;For countries whose electricity production is not modelled in ecoinvent (all but South Africa [ZA] for Area 1), coal-based electricity is assumed to be 78% hard coal, 22% lignite (based on 'rest of world' data, i.e. on data representing all regions not covered in ecoinvent v3.2).;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2015 data from IAI
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Aluminium-producing African countries (CM, EG, GH, MZ, NG, ZA)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal), shares of different types of coal power plants in ZA are used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: International Aluminium Institute (IAI) data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from coal power plants. ecoinvent data used to split coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal). The cited 100% representativeness is for IAI data (data based on 100% of regional aluminium production). The percent representativeness of data used to split coal based electricity production to different fuels (national grid proxy) is also 100% - all coal electricity for aluminium production found in ZA.

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology
